item.title: The dollar is rising
item.description:
Matthew Yglesias on Twitter

‚ÄúMonetary policy is weird ‚Äî the Fed hasn‚Äôt actually done anything, but just talking about tightening policy has pushed the dollar up a lot which tightens policy. At peak performance you never do anything at all, and just let markets react to expectations that you will do things.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/mattyglesias/status/1466378922413772811

item.title: Omicron is a reminder of how little we're doing on pandemic prevention
item.description:
In January of 2021, the Bipartisan Commission on Biodefense issued a proposal for an ambitious Apollo Program for Biodefense. The Biden administration largely embraced this vision and released a call for a $65 billion pandemic prevention initiative, but that turned into a $30 billion budget request as part of the original White House version of the Build Back Better proposal, which dwindled to a‚Ä¶

URL: https://www.slowboring.com/p/omicron-prevention?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: How Notable Is Science?
item.description:
Every year, it seems like the year-end signifiers‚Äî Christmas decorations in stores, colorful cups at Starbucks, grating holiday music‚Äî show up a few days earlier. In keeping with that, the New York Times ‚ÄúNotable Books‚Äù list has dropped. I think of this as a late December thing, but I guess it‚Äôs pre-Thanksgiving now‚Ä¶

URL: https://chadorzel.substack.com/p/how-notable-is-science?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: The Fox News Distortion Field and Other Media Maladies
item.description:
It‚Äôs now been a little more than a week since my friends, colleagues, and Dispatch co-founders Steve Hayes and Jonah Goldberg announced their resignations from Fox News. After days of online vitriol (and support), the dust has settled a bit, and it‚Äôs worth reflecting a bit on what they did and why it mattered‚Ä¶

item.title: "Stop and frisk" was really bad
item.description:
New York City mayor-elect Eric Adams recently wrote an op-ed flirting with the idea of bringing back the ‚Äústop and frisk‚Äù preventative policing policy. This is a sign of how far the politics of crime have shifted under the pressure of rising shootings, and in general, I think Democrats could learn a lot from Adams‚Äô success. But this particular gambit is a bridge too far ‚Äî anti-police activists say plenty that‚Äôs wrong, but they are fundamentally correct about stop and frisk‚Ä¶

URL: https://www.slowboring.com/p/eriic-adams-stop-frisk?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: The "Sister Souljah" Moment, in Reality; & BRIEFLY NOTED: For 2021-12-03 Fr
